questions.question: What's the 'Safe Touch' rule?
options: Option A) Hug everyone you meet
Option B) Let anyone touch you however they want
Option C) Only allow trusted adults to touch you in ways that keep you safe and comfortable
Option D) Touch others without asking

questions.question: How can you stay safe when you're home alone?
options: A) Open the door for anyone who knocks
B) Call a trusted adult if there's an emergency
C) Play video games loudly
D) Invite friends over to your house

questions.question: What's the right way to cross a road safely?
options: A) Run across as fast as you can
B) Cross anywhere you like
C) Look both ways, use a crosswalk or traffic signal, and wait for the signal to cross
D) Ask someone to carry you across

questions.question: How can you be safe when using the internet and social media?
options: A) Share personal information online with friends
B) Talk to strangers online and make new friends
C) Don't share personal information online, and tell a trusted adult if something online makes you uncomfortable
D) Post pictures of your school and home online

questions.question: What's the 'stranger danger' rule?
options: A) Be cautious around people you know well
B) Talk to strangers and make new friends
C) Always go with strangers when they offer you something
D) Be cautious around people you don't know and don't go anywhere with them

questions.question: What should you do if you get lost in a crowded place like a market?
options: A) Run around looking for your parents
B) Find a security guard or police officer and tell them your parents' phone number or home address
C) Hide and wait for someone to find you
D) Start crying loudly

questions.question: What is the importance of reporting bullying or harassment to adults or teachers?
options: A) To get someone in trouble
B) To make your friends laugh
C) To ensure your safety and stop the bullying from happening
D) To keep it a secret

questions.question: What is 'Child Labor,' and why is it wrong?
options: A) Child Labor is when children work to earn money for themselves, and it's not wrong
B) Child Labor is when children work in jobs that are dangerous or keep them from going to school, and it's wrong because it can harm them
C) Child Labor is when children do their homework at home, and it's wrong because they should do it at school
D) Child Labor is when children work on fun projects and get paid, and it's not wrong

questions.question: What does the term 'Child Rights' mean?
options: A) It means having the right to stay up late and play video games
B) It means having the right to be treated fairly and with respect as a child
C) It means having the right to eat all the candy you want
D) It means having the right to skip school whenever you want

questions.question: What is the 'Right to Education,' and why is it important?
options: A) The Right to Education means kids can choose whether or not to go to school, and it's not important
B) The Right to Education means every child has the right to go to school and get an education, and it's important because education helps kids have a better future
C) The Right to Education means kids can decide what they want to learn, and it's not important
D) The Right to Education means only rich kids can go to school, and it's not important
